official-title.#text:
To amend the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
		  to establish a public health insurance option.

cosponsor.#text: Mr. Ben Ray Luján of New Mexico

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Part 3 of subtitle D
			 of title I of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act

header.#text:
Establishment
				and administration of a public health insurance option

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
(in this
				subtitle referred to as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
’s primary responsibility is to
				create a low-cost plan without compromising quality or access to care.

text.#text:
For
				years beginning with 2014, the

The public health insurance option shall only be made
				available through Exchanges established under this title.

Consistent with
				this section, the public health insurance option shall comply with requirements
				that are applicable under this title to health benefits plans offered through
				such Exchanges, including requirements related to benefits, benefit levels,
				provider networks, notices, consumer protections, and cost sharing.
The public health insurance option—

shall offer bronze, silver, and gold plans;
				and

may offer
				platinum plans.

text.#text:
There
				is established in the Treasury of the United States an account for the receipts

				option, including the start-up funding under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, out of
				any funds in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $2,000,000,000. In order
				to provide for initial claims reserves before the collection of premiums, there
				is hereby appropriated to the

, out of any funds in the Treasury not
				otherwise appropriated, such sums as necessary to cover 90 days worth of claims
				reserves based on projected enrollment.

				health insurance option there is hereby appropriated to the

to the Treasury in an amortized manner over the 10-year period

header.#text:
Modernized
				payment initiatives and delivery system reform

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may utilize innovative payment mechanisms
				and policies to determine payments for items and services under the public
				health insurance option. The payment mechanisms and policies under this
				subsection may include patient-centered medical home and other care management
				payments, accountable care organizations, value-based purchasing, bundling of
				services, differential payment rates, performance or utilization based
				payments, partial capitation, and direct contracting with providers. Payment
				rates under such payment mechanisms and policies shall not be set at levels
				expected to increase average medical costs per enrollee covered under the
				public health insurance option beyond what would be expected if the process
				under
and
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1325/ss:c/p:1/sp:B

text.#text:

				beginning with 2014, the

text.#text: The
seeks to—

improve health
				outcomes;

reduce health
				disparities (including racial, ethnic, and other disparities);

provide
				efficient and affordable care;

address
				geographic variation in the provision of health services; or

prevent or manage
				chronic illness; and

promotes care that
				is integrated, patient-centered, high-quality, and efficient.

To the extent allowed by the benefit
				standards applied to all health benefits plans participating under the Exchange
				involved, the public health insurance option may modify cost sharing and
				payment rates to encourage the use of services that promote health and
				value.
